title: Why the focus on the search bar on the homepage and new tab automatically shifts to URL bar? I hate this. I cannot find any option to change this. Vivaldi gives us an option to decide what we want unlike Firefox.
content:
Why the focus on the search bar on the homepage and new tab automatically shifts to URL bar? I hate this. I cannot find any option to change this. Vivaldi gives us an option to decide what we want unlike Firefox.

Chrome focuses on the search bar on the new tab regardless, duckduckgo browser does same, edge does same, opera does same, Brave does same and Vivaldi does same but gives us option in the settings as in the image below. But Firefox automatically forces it. Why? Looks so cheap.

How to change this? I dont want this. I cannot see what I am typing when it shifts to smaller bar on the URL bar from the search bar.

And most importantly, I cannot change the new tab or homepage with any other search engine, like Duckduckgo or Ecosia or Brave Search, if I had any search engine addon from addon store. Chrome has no such BS show. If I am using Google, then new tab and homepage is of Google. But if I use any search, I have to suffer with underdeveloped same old FF new tab and homepage. Is this intentional or forced?

Edge is opening randomly, might be going back until this is user controlled.

https://connect.mozilla.org/t5/discussions/why-the-focus-on-the-search-bar-on-the-homepage-and-new-tab/m-p/81117#M31052
creator: Net_Hunter_90s

title: Lost passwords
content:
All my passwords are gone. My question is, how do I restore them?

It happened because Firefox has once again become so slow I can't use it, even to look up a solution to the problem, and apparently I misremembered the procedure from the last time, or maybe I just clicked the wrong thing. No message came up asking for confirmation that I wanted to delete them, but that doesn't seem to matter. Everything is gone.

Please note that this happened after I tried unsuccessfuly yet again to remove unwanted icons from my homepage -- because I thought all those unwanted icons from past searches might be slowing things down.

No doubt my frustration level led to a mistake, but I blame that on Firefox. Too slow almost all the time, covered in icons I do not want, and now my passwords have disappeared.

Please tell me how to restore them.

title: Lost recently closed windows, history missing completely
content:
Hello,

Usually both of my previously closed windows reopen without issue, but the data for both of them disappeared this time when I clicked on a zoom link after closing them. The link opened, but they didn't. I did the basic troubleshooting like checking my entire history (under "managed history") and looking in settings as well as following the instructions I found here at https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1407584, but everything's gone. It's like they never existed in the first place. Has anyone else had this issue?

Also, about a couple of months ago, Firefox started forgetting my accounts and logging me out of them once I closed the window/the tabs reloaded. Not sure if this is due to my computer's own storage (RAM) or an update-related issue - I haven't been able to figure it out yet.

Any insight on either or both of these is greatly appreciated!

title: Firefox extremely slow on youtube with just like 10-20 tabs
content:
I tried all common troubleshooting steps: deleting cache reinstalling different settings turning off adblocker/vpn disabled efficiency in task manager and set it permanently to off in FF

I used to have 1000+ tabs in 2016 no issue. I had problem in past with Firefox using 100% CPU which now it is not using only like 50, but memory is getting full 89% i use also large page file on ssd. Problem is even when i restart firefox it is slow with low RAM usage! SO that's not it! Even 5 tabs sometimes it is slow!

It is so damn slow it drives me crazy! I tried also Quantum in past when Firefox has 100% CPU usage bug and it was only tiny bit better but still caused 100% CPU usage!

All other browsers are anti user cannot even stop Autoplay literal terrorist Firefox is only normal browser unfortunately performance compare to 2016 got absolutely abysmal! I had this problem even in-between reinstals of OS so it doesn't seem it is me. I play demanding games no issues on my PC...

title: How to reduce excess spacing between lines in drop-down menus like bookmarks and right-click AGAIN
content:
Hi All, 

I know this subject was asked and answered before but for the life of me I cannot get it to work.

Ok I have V133 Firefox but this still seems to fit the bill.. [[Knowledge Base Article|https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1346987]]

I Watched the video on how to create the userChrome.css and text file. Then opened a text file inside userChrome.css, I then Copied and pasted, @namespace url("http://www.mozilla.org/keymaster/gatekeeper/there.is.only.xul"); /* only needed once */

menupopup > menuitem, menupopup > menu {padding-top: 2px !important; padding-bottom: 2px !important;}

  • |*:root {--arrowpanel-menuitem-padding: 2px 8px !important;}

to said text file saved it. Next I went and set this pref to true on the about:config page to enable userChrome.css but not sure if that did this one as well "userContent.css in the chrome folder. I then closed (Quit/Exit) and restart Firefox when you create or modify the userChrome.css file.

Nothing seems to have changed please what did I do wrong? Thanks in advance for help.
